snippet: A jury in Florida awarded a staggering $23 billion judgment against R. J. Reynolds, the country’s second-largest tobacco company, for causing the death of a smoker who died of lung cancer at the age of 36.
abstract: Florida jury awards staggering $23 billion judgement against R J Reynolds, the country's second-largest tobacco company, for causing the death of chain smoker Michael Johnson Sr; Reynolds issues immediate appeal.
lead_paragraph: A jury in Florida awarded a staggering $23 billion judgment against R. J. Reynolds, the country’s second-largest tobacco company, for causing the death of a smoker who died of lung cancer at the age of 36.

headline.main: Jury Awards $23.6 Billion in Florida Smoking Case
